analysisEngineMetaData.name: Flesch Reading Ease
analysisEngineMetaData.description:
The code for the calculation of the Flesch Reading Ease measure of readability
206.835 - (84.6 * mean_token_length_in_syllables) - (1.015 * mean_sentence_length_in_tokens)
Scores can be interpreted as shown in the table below:
100.00–90.00 5th grade Very easy to read. Easily understood by an average 11-year-old student. 90.0–80.0 6th grade Easy to read. Conversational English for consumers. 80.0–70.0 7th grade Fairly easy to read. 70.0–60.0 8th and 9th grade Plain English. Easily understood by 13- to 15-year-old students. 60.0–50.0 10th to 12th grade Fairly difficult to read. 50.0–30.0 College Difficult to read. 30.0–0.0 College graduate Very difficult to read. Best understood by university graduates.
